About.title: Linux Basics
About.paragraph: This module covers essential Linux skills that every DevOps engineer needs. Learn file system navigation, shell scripting, system administration, and more.

About1.title: Version Control with Git
About1.paragraph: Master the fundamentals of Git, the most popular version control system. Learn how to track changes, collaborate in teams, and manage branches.
Why: Git basics (init, clone, commit, push, pull)

CI_CD_Pipelines.title: CI/CD Pipelines
CI_CD_Pipelines.paragraph: Understand the principles of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery/Deployment (CD) using modern tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or Azure Pipelines.
Why2: Tools: Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, Azure DevOps

IaC_Configuration_Management.title: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and Configuration Management
IaC_Configuration_Management.paragraph: Learn how to automate infrastructure using IaC tools like Terraform and manage configurations using Ansible or other tools.

Containerization_Docker.title: Containerization with Docker
Containerization_Docker.paragraph: This module dives into containers and Docker. Learn how to build, manage, and orchestrate containers for microservices.

Container_Orchestration_Kubernetes.title: Container Orchestration with Kubernetes
Container_Orchestration_Kubernetes.paragraph: Learn how to orchestrate containers at scale using Kubernetes (K8s). This module covers key concepts like pods, services, deployments, and more.

Monitoring_Logging.title: Monitoring and Logging
Monitoring_Logging.paragraph: Monitoring and logging are crucial in a production environment. Learn how to monitor system performance, track logs, and set up alerts.
Why: Log aggregation with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Centralized logging with Fluentd or Filebeat

GitOps_Infrastructure_Automation.title: GitOps and Infrastructure Automation
GitOps_Infrastructure_Automation.paragraph: This module focuses on GitOps, an operational framework that takes DevOps principles to the next level using Git as the source of truth for infrastructure management.

Real_World_DevOps_Project.title: Real-world DevOps Project
Real_World_DevOps_Project.paragraph: The final module is a hands-on project where students will apply all the concepts learned in the course. This capstone project will simulate real-world scenarios to deploy, manage, and monitor an application in a cloud environment.
Why: Setting up a CI/CD pipeline from scratch
Deploying a microservices architecture using Docker and Kubernetes
Automating infrastructure provisioning with Terraform and Ansible
